resources.string: When Privacy Guard is enabled, the app will not be able to access personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs.
When enabling Privacy Guard for a built-in app, the app will not be able to access or provide personal data. This may cause other apps to misbehave.
Enable by default for newly-installed apps
Manage which apps have access to your personal data

In this screen you can choose which apps Privacy Guard should be active for by simply tapping on them. Selected apps will not be able to access your personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs. Long pressing an app\'s entry opens its app details screen.\n\nBuilt-in apps are not shown by default but can be revealed by selecting the respective menu option.
Show notification if privacy guard is active.
Allowing applications to request root access is very dangerous and could compromise the security of your system!
Are you sure you wish to reset counters?
Press on color below to apply
Disabling the camera shutter sound is illegal in some areas! Please check the applicable law in your country
Prevent loud volume levels when headset is first plugged in
Listening at high volume for long periods may damage your hearing. Disable it with caution.
Limit the notification sounds of each app to only play once per set time period
Volume keys control media volume rather than notifications
Pressing the volume rocker up/down will wake the device
Wake up device if charger is plugged/unplugged.
Landscape keyboard will never take up entire screen
Force auto-rotate when keyboard is shown
Disables auto-rotate sensor %1$s seconds after keyboard is hidden
This feature forces auto-rotate to turn on temporarily while the keyboard is shown. It has no effect when auto-rotate is already enabled.
Force keyboard to show enter instead of emoticon key
Display left and right cursor buttons in navigation bar while typing. Longpress to navigate up/down. Overrides IME switcher and menu buttons.
Include options in the power menu for rebooting into recovery and bootloader
Show notifications from this app on the lockscreen
Never show ongoing notifications from this app on the lockscreen
Display a notification when USB debugging is connected
Abbreviated day of the week before the time
Display custom date before the clock
Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy
Notification text animation in the statusbar
Adjust brightness by sliding across status bar
Double tap status bar to put the device to sleep
%1$s edge of the status bar pulls down Quick Settings
Open Quick Settings when there are %1$s notifications present
Disable quick settings on secure lockscreen.
Two main tiles on the first row
Three or four tiles on each row
Enable advanced settings for location in Quick Settings
Swap volume buttons when the screen is rotated
Check the proximity sensor prior to waking up screen
Maximum entries size has been reached
It is not possible to delete last entry
It is not possible to delete required buttons
Disabled\nAdd an entry to enable this feature
The chosen app did not return a valid icon or does not support image cropping. Use another app.
The chosen action cannot be added twice
, while selecting the icon will bring up customization options

To add a %1$s, select the Add icon. Once a %1$s is added, selecting the row will change the target%2$s

To remove a %1$s, swipe the row horizontally left or right. Re-order a %1$s in the list by vertically dragging the anchor on the left.

To clear or reset to defaults, select the reset option.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the feature entirely.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the second pie layer entirely.
No other navigation is currently enabled. Turning off the navigation bar can result in an unusable device. Do you want to enable pie controls instead?
Unlock automatically when the correct PIN/password is entered
Superuser indicator when su session is active
View or change custom lock screen shortcuts
Change the order of PIN pad numbers
Enable the Android Debug Bridge (adb) interface
Enable TCP/IP debugging over network interfaces (Wi\u2011Fi, USB networks). This setting is reset on reboot

WARNING: When ADB over network is enabled, your phone is open for intrusions on all connected networks, including GSM data network!

Only use this feature when you are connected on trusted networks.

Do you really want to enable this function?
Time that the screen stays on for notification pulse
Ambient display pulse will be triggered by pick up gesture sensor events
Pick up gesture sensor will not be utilized as a triggering mechanism
Ambient display pulse will be triggered by significant motion sensor events
Significant motion sensor will not be utilized as a triggering mechanism
Ambient display pulse will be triggered by notifications
Notifications will not be utilized as a trigger
Predefined ambient display repeat intervals (normally [1s,10s,30s,60s,120s]) will be used (default)
Ambient display will only pulse once per notification/trigger
Brightness level of ambient display pulse screen (% of max allowed brightness)
You have no button assigned any more to the \"Home\" action!\n\nThis can make your device unusable!
Where do you want the menu buttons to appear?
How and when do you want the menu buttons to appear?
Navigation bar height while in portrait.
Navigation bar height while in landscape.
Navigation bar height if the bar is along a side.
Shows navigation bar in landscape on the bottom
Reset all dimensions entries to default?
Reset all style entries to default?
Dim navigation bar buttons after not interacting with navigation bar for a specified time
Time (in milliseconds) to wait before dimming buttons
Alpha value to dim buttons to
Duration (in milliseconds) of the alpha animation
Listen for touches on entire screen
Touching anywhere on the screen will cause buttons to un-dim
Only touches on the navbar will cause buttons to un-dim
Change the navigation bar button color mode
Heads up notifications are en-/disabled on a per app basis
Heads up notifications are force enabled for all apps
Show heads up notifications on a per app basis
Show notifications from this app as heads up
Heads up are currently globally disabled in notification settings
Heads up are currently globally enabled in notification settings
If snooze button is pressed, disable heads up for %d minutes
Heads up notification will show up for %d seconds
Heads up notification will show until it is dismissed
Top pie does not show status and clock information
Change the button icon color mode
To avoid conflicts with status bar or navigation bar, the triggers on these edges are automatically turned off if one or both are available
Mirror right pie on the horizontal axis
Shows snap points to change the trigger edge dynamically
Shows phone status, time and date information
No other navigation is currently enabled. Turning off pie controls can result in an unusable device. Do you want to enable navigation bar instead?
Minimum one of the main triggers (bottom, left or right) needs to be enabled.
Reduces left and right trigger size if keyboard is active
Don\'t exclude the topmost task in recents view
Show recent apps panel on the left edge
Double tap status bar or lock screen slider to put the device to sleep
Dynamically adjust the brightness of the display\'s backlight to maximize battery life while maintaining usability
Enhance display brightness and readability under bright sunlight
Dynamically enhance the color of the display
Values higher than %1$d are not recommended
Launch the default music app when headset is connected
Optimize your screen based on time of day and ambient conditions to improve readibility and reduce eyestrain
Increase brightness and saturation automatically under bright sunlight
Adjust display for lowest power consumption without degradation
Improve color vibrance of flesh tones, scenery, and other images
Tune screen hue, saturation, contrast or intensity
Increase touchscreen sensitivity so it can be used while wearing gloves
Allows you to hover the screen like a mouse in web browsers, remote desktops, etc
You don\'t have any blacklisted numbers. Add an entry by touching the Add (+) button.
To blacklist calls and/or messages from certain numbers, enable the blacklist.
Incoming calls and messages from phone numbers in the blacklist will be blocked
Don\'t block calls from private numbers
Don\'t block calls or messages from numbers not in the contact list
Block incoming %s from numbers not in the contact list
Use . as a wildcard and * for repetition. E.g. 123.* blocks numbers starting with 123 and .*123.* blocks numbers containing 123
Unable to add invalid number to blacklist
Do you want to remove this blacklist entry?
To add a custom per-app configuration for expanded state, set \'Enabled for all\' to the off position
Choose a default expanded desktop style
The chamber of secrets has opened
Show in battery statistics unaccounted and over-counted usage.

These settings are experimental and any applied changes have the potential to cause instability, crashes, data loss or hardware failures.\n\nWe request that you do not file bug reports if any settings are changed from their defaults.
Automatically choose an appropriate performance profile for various applications

Tap the edit icon to open the navigation ring for editing.

Select a target to configure its behavior.

Tap the check mark icon to save your changes, or restore to reset the settings to defaults.

To get started tap the edit icon to unlock the navigation bar for editing.

You can tap an icon to change its shortcut, or long press an icon to re-arrange the layout.

Tap save to commit your changes, or restore to reset the layout to default settings.
Delete current settings and restore the default layout?
